definition: water/river/liquid/beverage/additional charges or income/(of clothes) classifier for number of washes
to hand over/to deliver/to pay (money)/to turn over/to make friends/to intersect (lines)/variant of 跤[jiao1]
to go through/to know well/(suffix) expert/to connect/to communicate/open/to clear/classifier for letters, telegrams, phone calls etc
classifier for an activity, taken in its entirety (tirade of abuse, stint of music playing, bout of drinking etc)

sentences.english: Beautiful scenery, is extremely advantageous geographical conditions, water and land transportation accessible.
sentences.chinese: 山水秀丽，地理条件十分优越，水陆交通四通八达。

sentences.english: The convenient land and water transport is conducive to the development of export-oriented economy.
sentences.chinese: 水陆交通便利，有利于外向型经济的发展。

sentences.english: Beilun port in the north, along the southeast coast of China's major sea and land transport hub.
sentences.chinese: 北靠北仑港，是我国东南沿海重要的水陆交通枢纽。

sentences.english: Endowed with unique location, Hamburg becomes the center of water and land transportation.
sentences.chinese: 得天独厚的地理位置，使汉堡成为水陆交通的中心。

sentences.english: Bao ying County is an important material transfer place in the middle Jiangsu Area, and the terraqueous transport of Bao ying is very convenient.
sentences.chinese: 宝应县是苏中地区物资转运要邑，水陆交通十分便利。

sentences.english: In history, Hubei has been a hub of both water and land transportation in China.
sentences.chinese: 湖北历来为中国水陆交通运输枢纽。

definition: to be located at/to be situated in
(old) to transport by water/to ship grain as tax
roads open in all directions (idiom); accessible from all sides
water and land/by water and land (transport)/amphibian/delicacies from land and sea
